title: Setting Width based on ActualWidth introduces render bug
body: When I set the width of a Grid inside a ListView.ItemTemplate to the ActualWidth of the Parent ListView, the first element won't render content. If I remove it, the first line renders correctly. If I remove/re-add that line or add a name/remove a name property, some redraw happens and the first line becomes visible. I tried to work around it to force an UpdateLayout on the elements, but to no avail.

comments.body: The issue is that the ListView creates a ListViewItem control that holds whatever content you're providing in your DataTemplate and the ListViewItem (which derives from ContentControl) by default has its HorizontalContentAlignment property set to Left instead of Stretch.
